actions.recommendation: You examine well with a good baseline. If any concerns arise to seek medical review.

As you get older (>40 years) - routine screening of your prostate becomes important to help early detection & management of any irregularities. In males, this means regular prostate examinations & PSA blood levels. You will only need this later in life.
Maintaining good lifestyle routines, including a healthy diet & regular exercise, can have a positive preventative impact. All this leading to better general well-being & health outcomes.
There were no current concerning symptoms. You report a good baseline. If you develop anything of concern - to follow up for review with your GP.
